verb.description: Tie (an animal) with a rope or chain so as to restrict its movement.
examples: the horse had been tethered to a post

verb.description: Use (a smartphone) in order to connect a computer or other device to the Internet.
examples: one prediction is that tethering will cost around $30 per month, probably with some cap on the amount of data transfer allowed

noun.description: A rope or chain with which an animal is tied to restrict its movement.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old Norse tjóthr, from a Germanic base meaning fasten.
